meanings.definition: To surpass in glowing or shining
meanings.sent1: The sun was outglowing all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was outglowing the brightness of the room.
meanings.sent3: The firefly thought it was outglowing the moon with its tiny light.
meanings.sent4: The city lights were outglowing the fireworks on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse was outglowing the stormy night, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing in glowing or shining
meanings.sent1: The outglowing of the bonfire caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The outglowing of the neon sign made it visible from far away.
meanings.sent3: The outglowing of the disco ball made the dance floor sparkle.
meanings.sent4: The outglowing of the full moon lit up the entire forest.
meanings.sent5: The outglowing of the fireflies created a magical atmosphere in the garden.
